means: 听到，听见( hear的过去式和过去分词 )
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 赫德职业名称，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“牧人”(herdsman)

sentence.Network_en: He stood emotionless as he heard the judge pass sentence.
sentence.Network_cn: 他面无表情地站在那里，听法官宣布判决。

sentence.Network_en: Flying at 1,000 ft. he heard a peculiar noise from the rotors.
sentence.Network_cn: 在1,000英尺的高度飞行时，他听到旋翼发出一种奇怪的噪音。

sentence.Network_en: Rose heard the familiar voice, but tuned out the words.
sentence.Network_cn: 罗斯听到了熟悉的声音，但没注意听说的是什么。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 自己总结不定词--过去式--过去分词 - 豆丁网 ... hear 听到，听； heard 闻知；听到 heave 举起；使起伏；.
动词过去式不规则不规则大全_百度知道 ... give         gave 给；授予 hear         heard 听见；听说 know        knew 知道；了解.
well i heard mister young sing about her ., 我听说年轻人都在歌唱她.
when i , sitting , heard the astronomer , where he lectured with much applause in the lecture - room ., 只要坐听那天文学家在教室讲得满堂喝采.

list.abs: uh , hey , joe , i heard you shot your old lady down ., 嗯 , 嗨 , 乔 , 我听说你开枪你的老太太了.
when they heard the sound of drums ., 当他们听到鼓声的时分.
when they heard the good news they shouted for joy ., 他们听到这个好消息都叫了起来.
and then I heard what those low - lifes were thinking ., 然后我听到那些低级生物在想什么.
英语句型功能大总结 ... 29. Please don’t hesitate to… 请随时…… 30. I heard… 我听说…… 31. Everybody says… 所有人都在说…….

entry.def: When you hear a sound, you become aware of it through your ears.

example.ex: She heard no further sounds...
example.tran: 她再没有听到别的声音了。

example.ex: The trumpet can be heard all over their house...
example.tran: 喇叭声整栋房子都能听见。

entry.def: If you hear something such as a lecture or a piece of music, you listen to it.

example.ex: You can hear commentary on the match in about half an hour's time...
example.tran: 大约半小时后就能听到这场比赛的解说了。

example.ex: I don't think you've ever heard Doris talking about her emotional life before...
example.tran: 我想你以前从未听过多丽丝谈自己的感情生活。

entry.def: If you say that you can hear someone saying something, you mean that you are able to imagine hearing it.

example.ex: Can't you just hear John Motson now?...
example.tran: 你脑海里现在没有响起约翰·莫特森的声音吗？

example.ex: 'I was hot,' I could still hear Charlotte say with her delicious French accent.
example.tran: “我很热，”夏洛特那带有甜美法国口音的话语仍在我的脑际盘旋。

entry.tran: （法官或法庭）审理（案件），听取（证词）
entry.def: When a judge or a court of law hears a case, or evidence in a case, they listen to it officially in order to make a decision about it.

example.ex: The jury have heard evidence from defence witnesses...
example.tran: 陪审团已经听取了辩方证人的证词。

example.ex: He had to wait months before his case was heard.
example.tran: 等了数月后，他的案子才得到审理。

entry.def: If you hear from someone, you receive a letter or telephone call from them.

example.ex: Drop us a line, it's always great to hear from you...
example.tran: 给我们写封短信，能收到你的信总是让人很高兴。

example.ex: The police are anxious to hear from anyone who may know her.
example.tran: 警方急切地希望任何可能认识她的人打电话来。

entry.tran: （辩论或讨论中）倾听（意见或情况）
entry.def: In a debate or discussion, if you hear from someone, you listen to them giving their opinion or information.

example.ex: What are you hearing from people there?
example.tran: 你在那里都听到人们说了些什么？

entry.def: If you hear some news or information about something, you find out about it by someone telling you, or from the radio or television.

example.ex: My mother heard of this school through Leslie...
example.tran: 我母亲是从莱斯利那里知道这所学校的。

example.ex: ...the rumours I've been hearing about for years...
example.tran: 多年来我一直听说的一些谣言

entry.def: If you have heard of something or someone, you know about them, but not in great detail.

example.ex: Many people haven't heard of reflexology.
example.tran: 很多人没听说过反射学。

example.ex: ...people who, maybe, had hardly heard the word till a year or two ago.
example.tran: 那些可能直到一两年前才听说这个词的人们

entry.def: If you say that you have heard something before, you mean that you are not interested in it, or do not believe it, or are not surprised about it, because you already know about it or have experienced it.

example.ex: Furness shrugs wearily. He has heard it all before...
example.tran: 弗内斯疲倦地耸了耸肩。这事他早就全知道了。

example.ex: 'How many times have I heard that before?' Merchant complained angrily.
example.tran: “我听过有多少次了？”麦钱特生气地抱怨道。

entry.tran: “听见没有？”“你听到我的话了吗？”（要求对方注意听自己的话）
entry.def: If you say 'Do you hear?' or 'Did you hear me?' to someone, you are telling them in an angry or forceful way to pay attention to what you are saying.

example.ex: If you don't get out I'll call the police. Do you hear?...
example.tran: 如果你不出去，我就要报警了。听见没有？

example.ex: Leave her alone! Do you hear me?
example.tran: 别惹她！听见了吗？

entry.tran: 说得对！说得好！（政治辩论或公众大会上对讲话人表示赞同的喝彩声）
entry.def: During political debates and public meetings, people sometimes say 'Hear hear!' to express their agreement with what the speaker is saying.
If you say that you can't hear yourself think, you are complaining and emphasizing that there is a lot of noise, and that it is disturbing you or preventing you from doing something.

example.ex: For God's sake shut up. I can't hear myself think!...
example.tran: 看在老天爷的份上，闭嘴吧。吵死我了！

example.ex: If you're sitting in the front yard, you can't hear yourself think because the traffic is getting very, very bad.
example.tran: 如果你坐在前院，就会被吵死，因为外面交通太混乱了。

entry.def: If you say that you won't hear of someone doing something, you mean that you refuse to let them do it.

example.ex: I've always wanted to be an actor but Dad wouldn't hear of it...
example.tran: 我一直想当个演员，但爸爸不同意。

example.ex: He even thought about moving from the village. But his friends wouldn't hear of it.
example.tran: 他甚至考虑要从村子里搬出去。但他的朋友们不答应。

means.word_mean: 1. detected or perceived by the sense of hearing;

auth_sentence.content: In recent days he has not been heard from.
auth_sentence.res_content: In recent days he has not been heard from.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In recent days he has not been heard from.

auth_sentence.content: Residents say the explosion was heard across the city.
auth_sentence.res_content: Residents say the explosion was heard across the city.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Residents say the explosion was heard across the city.

auth_sentence.content: We heard the mob was coming towards our house.
auth_sentence.res_content: We heard the mob was coming towards our house.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We heard the mob was coming towards our house.

Sentence.sentence: I heard you have moved to a new house in the suburb.
They will include plenty of names no one has yet heard of.
Questions 23 to 25 are based on the conversation you have just heard.
I only heard about the delay yesterday because we kept the production line clear to handle these special sheets.
Questions 16 to 18 are based on the passage you have just heard
You've now heard it so many times, you can probably repeat it in your sleep.
